p: News Import is a Final Cut Pro Workflow Extension that allows you to import NewsML-G2 and VPMS metadata into Final Cut Pro.
Click here to buy on the Mac App Store
If you have footage that contains a .newsml.xml and/or .vpms.xml sidecar file, this tools allows you to access this metadata from within a supplied Final Cut Pro Metadata View.
This is useful if you're working with news outlets that use the NewsML-G2 standard or a VPMS system, and you need to reference this metadata for deliverables.
News Import works well alongside other 3rd party applications such as Producers Best Friend.
This is a simple niche app, that saves high-end professional assistant editors using Final Cut Pro hours of time.
News Import is a one-time payment of USD$500 on the Mac App Store.
Click here to buy on the Mac App Store
You can find information about Educational Pricing here.
Educational institutions can get a 50% discount when they purchase 20 or more copies through Apple School Manager.
Please contact Apple if you need help with Educational Pricing.
News Import requires Final Cut Pro 10.6.5 or later.
You can find Final Cut Pro's system requirements here.
After dragging in an Event, the Drag to your Final Cut Pro Library button will now be blue:
All the metadata from the sidecar files will now be accessible from the Info Inspector.
As instructed, please restart Final Cut Pro.
Because News Import is a sandbox application, you need to grant it access to the drive or folder that contains your footage.
Click Grant Permission.
Click the Add Media Location button to add a new Media Location.
Clicking Launch Final Cut Pro will launch Final Cut Pro and close the News Import application.
For example, I've granted News Import access to my system drive:
For example, you should have three files all next to each other:
IMPORTANT: Make sure the .newsml.xml and/or .vpms.xml files are in the same folder as the media file and have matching names.
News Import
NewsML-G2
Select the drive or folder that contains your footage, then click Grant Permission.
The first time you open the News Import Workflow Extension it will look like this:
The News Import Metadata View contains all the values from both NewsML-G2 and VPMS.
This will create a new Event, however, you can delete this Event straight away, as the Metadata will be automatically applied to the original source clips.
To get started you need to press the Install Metadata View button.
video_001.mxf
video_001.newsml.xml
video_001.vpms.xml
VPMS
When you first run News Import from the Mac App Store you'll be presented with this:
You can access these Metadata Views at the bottom of Final Cut Pro's Info Inspector:
You can also access it from the Workflow Extension menubar:
You can now access News Import from the Workflow Extension button in Final Cut Pro:
You can now drag an Event which contains footage to the Drop Event Here area.
You can now drag this Event back into your Final Cut Pro Library(in the Browser).
You should check that you have Leave files in place selected in the Final Cut Pro preferences, otherwise the media files will be inside the Library bundle.
You'll be presented with a window like this:
You'll be presented with this message:
You'll now be able to access three new Metadata Views in Final Cut Pro:
If there's a metadata field missing that you require, or if there's a different News sidecar file that we don't currently support, please let us know.

We currently support the following NewsML-G2 Metadata Fields:
We currently support the following VPMS Metadata Fields:
If you run into any bugs, crashes, or you have a feature request, you can post an issue here.
If you have any general questions or feedback, you can discuss here.
GitHub registration is free, and this GitHub repository is actively monitored by LateNite Films.
You can also email us: support@latenitefilms.com
We're based in Melbourne, Australia- you can check the timezone here.
25th June 2024
Added support for FCPXML v1.12 and Final Cut Pro 10.8.
Added support for VPMS XML sidecar files.
18th June 2024
This is the first release of News Import. Woohoo!
To uninstall News Import, simply drag the application to the trash/bin.
You can manually remove the installed Metadata Views from:
You can manually remove the Preferences for the Workflow Extension with this Terminal command:
News Import has been thrown together by Chris Hocking at LateNite.
The FCPXML Processing Engine used under-the-hood was created by David Peterson.
The News Import icon was designed by the amazing Matthew Skiles.
Chris also created CommandPost, Transfer Toolbox, BRAW Toolbox, Marker Toolbox and Gyroflow Toolbox.
You can learn more about Chris's creations over at FCP Cafe.
We use FCPXMLKit by David Peterson to handle FCPXML processing.
This is a private framework.

This is the privacy policy for the News Import, macOS Application that is available on the macOS App Store and TestFlight.
News Import does not collect any user data. No personal information is transmitted, stored, or used by this application.
News Import does not use any third-party analytics or tracking tools. It does not contain any in-app purchases or advertisements.
Apple may collect and use certain usage and performance data from the apps that are available on the App Store. This data is used to help improve the App Store and the overall user experience.
This data collection is not specific to any individual user, and it is not possible for app developers to opt out of this data collection by Apple.
You can read Apple's App Store Privacy Policy here.
We use this GitHub Repository for documentation hosting and technical support. You can read GitHub's Privacy Policy here.
If you have any questions or concerns, you can submit an issue, or email us: support@latenitefilms.com
